alert.note: Alert for King (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 5:08AM PST until January 07 at 7:50PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Issaquah Creek Near Issaquah affecting King County. .Heavy rain combined with low level snow melt pushed Issaquah Creek Near Issaquah over flood stage Thursday. The river will remain above flood stage this morning then recede below flood stage this afternoon. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Issaquah Creek Near Issaquah. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 2000.0 cfs, Issaquah Creek will flood most low areas in the valley. Swift waters will flood residential and business areas and roads including Newport Way. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM PST Friday the flow was 2030.0 cfs. - Recent Activity...The maximum river flow in the 24 hours ending at 3:15 AM PST Friday was 2050.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river will crest near 2050 cfs this morning. The river will remain fairly steady through the morning hours then start receding this afternoon. - Flood flow is 2000.0 cfs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 115 PM PST.
